text:
Hardik Pandya and KL Rahul made a comeback on the cricket field after being suspended for their “sexist and misogynistic” comments on Koffee With Karan in ODI series against New Zealand and England respectively. However, the controversy surrounding the show isn’t over yet.
Also Read: Priya Malik Slams Hardik Pandya With Her Powerful Poetry, Schools Him On Why Misogyny Isn’t Cool
Now a case has been registered in Jodhpur against Hardik Pandya and KL Rahul and also Bollywood filmmaker Karan Johar in the same regard. The case has been filed by D R Meghwal at a police station in Luni in Jodhpur under various sections of the Indian Penal Code.

Pandya, who shared the couch with Rahul on the latest episode of Karan Johar's show, faced backlash for what netizens termed 'sexist' and 'disrespectful' remarks on women. On the show, he bragged about not asking the names of women at parties and how he watched them move on the dance floor.
Hardik Pandya had also issued an apology for the remarks saying he "may have got a bit carried away with the nature of the show".
